name: I cornered you! A human painball game
name_original: I cornered you! A human painball game
description:
For the first time in videogame History, dwelve into the daily life of one of the most --if not THE most-- frightening enemies of the whole a humanity. Behold. Furniture's corners.

In I cornered you! A human painball game, you place furniture in a room to make sure your human owner will trip and break a leg or two. Aim for corners to hurt your human and have them bounce all around the room in pain. So cute! 😵💥

Get your human all the way to the telephone or right through the window to get your score all the way to furniture paradise! 🪑🛏🛋

NB: current version only works with the first level as of the jam deadline! More to come very soon. Maybe.

How to Play?

Drag and drop the furniture around. Use the wheel mouse to rotate it. Let your human in when everything is set up by pressing the green button. 

This game was made by ENJMIN students during the 48-hour jam ENJAM 2020 on the theme "Wait, are we the bad guys?"

We followed some of the challenges proposed by the event:

  • making the color-code mostly yellow 💛
  • tweeting low-quality posts every hour during production 🗯
  • using a power-mode while programming 🎆
  • sharing your lore with another game made during the jam 👩‍👧‍👧
